answers.author: Steven Barkley
answers.text:
The city of Durango, CO has a large number of bike races, and we work in conjunction with the various Organizers to ensure safety of the race and road users. One of the referenced races is the Iron Horse Bicycle Classic. This race runs from Durango to Silverton Colorado racing the Steam engine train. This race has a limited number of riders permitted and an alloted road closure time as well. These limits were placed in conjunction  with Colorado Highway patrol, Colorado Highway Dept., Durango Police, and Special events Dept., working with IHBC . Collaboration with different agencies and the public is Imperative to ensure safety and conveniance to all involved.

author: Frank Lancaster
text: Has anyone developed guidelines for bike races on public roads?  Specifically  any guidelines for number of competitors or densities of racers when using rural roads or in mountainous areas.  We're having issues with races that are outgrowing the venue to a point of being dangerous or too disruptive to the adjacent community.  We're trying to find a compromise balance that meets the needs of the race organizers and the neighbors.
title: Guidelines for Bike Races
